segment.source: Configuring UE-V 2.x with System Center Configuration Manager 2012
segment.target: Configuring UE-V 2.x with System Center Configuration Manager 2012

segment.source: Configuring UE-V 2.x with System Center Configuration Manager 2012
segment.target: Configuring UE-V 2.x with System Center Configuration Manager 2012

segment.source: Configuring UE-V 2.x with System Center Configuration Manager 2012
segment.target: Configuring UE-V 2.x with System Center Configuration Manager 2012

segment.source: After you install Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) 2.0, 2.1, or 2.1 SP1 and their required features, UE-V must be configured.
segment.target: After you install Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) 2.0, 2.1, or 2.1 SP1 and their required features, UE-V must be configured.

segment.source: The UE-V Configuration Pack provides a way for administrators to use the Compliance Settings feature of System Center Configuration Manager 2012 SP1 or later to apply consistent configurations across sites where UE-V and Configuration Manager are installed.
segment.target: The UE-V Configuration Pack provides a way for administrators to use the Compliance Settings feature of System Center Configuration Manager 2012 SP1 or later to apply consistent configurations across sites where UE-V and Configuration Manager are installed.

segment.source: UE-V Configuration Pack supported features
segment.target: UE-V Configuration Pack supported features

segment.source: The UE-V Configuration Pack includes tools to perform the following tasks:
segment.target: The UE-V Configuration Pack includes tools to perform the following tasks:

segment.source: Create or update UE-V settings location template distribution baselines.
segment.target: Create or update UE-V settings location template distribution baselines.

segment.source: Define UE-V templates to be registered or unregistered
segment.target: Define UE-V templates to be registered or unregistered

segment.source: Update UE-V template configuration items and baselines as templates are added or updated
segment.target: Update UE-V template configuration items and baselines as templates are added or updated

segment.source: Distribute and register UE-V templates using standard Configuration Item remediation
segment.target: Distribute and register UE-V templates using standard Configuration Item remediation

segment.source: Create or update a UE-V Agent policy configuration item to set or clear these settings.
segment.target: Create or update a UE-V Agent policy configuration item to set or clear these settings.

segment.source: Max package size
segment.target: Max package size

segment.source: Enable/disable Windows app sync
segment.target: Enable/disable Windows app sync

segment.source: Wait for sync on application start
segment.target: Wait for sync on application start

segment.source: Setting import delay
segment.target: Setting import delay

segment.source: Sync unlisted Windows apps
segment.target: Sync unlisted Windows apps

segment.source: Wait for sync on logon
segment.target: Wait for sync on logon

segment.source: Settings import notification
segment.target: Settings import notification

segment.source: IT contact URL
segment.target: IT contact URL

segment.source: Wait for sync timeout
segment.target: Wait for sync timeout

segment.source: Settings storage path
segment.target: Settings storage path

segment.source: IT contact descriptive text
segment.target: IT contact descriptive text

segment.source: Settings template catalog path
segment.target: Settings template catalog path

segment.source: Sync enablement
segment.target: Sync enablement

segment.source: Tray icon enabled
segment.target: Tray icon enabled

segment.source: Start/Stop UE-V agent service
segment.target: Start/Stop UE-V agent service

segment.source: Sync method
segment.target: Sync method

segment.source: First use notification
segment.target: First use notification

segment.source: Define which Windows apps will roam settings
segment.target: Define which Windows apps will roam settings

segment.source: Sync timeout
segment.target: Sync timeout

segment.source: Verify compliance by confirming that UE-V is running.
segment.target: Verify compliance by confirming that UE-V is running.

segment.source: Generate a UE-V Agent Policy Configuration Item
segment.target: Generate a UE-V Agent Policy Configuration Item

segment.source: All UE-V Agent policy and configuration is distributed through a single configuration item that is generated using the UevAgentPolicyGenerator.exe tool.
segment.target: All UE-V Agent policy and configuration is distributed through a single configuration item that is generated using the UevAgentPolicyGenerator.exe tool.

segment.source: This tool reads the desired configuration from an XML configuration file and creates a CI containing the discovery and remediation settings needed to bring the machine into compliance.
segment.target: This tool reads the desired configuration from an XML configuration file and creates a CI containing the discovery and remediation settings needed to bring the machine into compliance.

segment.source: The UE-V Agent policy configuration item CAB file is created using the UevTemplateBaselineGenerator.exe command line tool, which has these parameters:
segment.target: The UE-V Agent policy configuration item CAB file is created using the UevTemplateBaselineGenerator.exe command line tool, which has these parameters:

segment.source: Site site code
segment.target: Site site code

segment.source: PolicyName name Optional: Defaults to “UE-V Agent Policy” if not present
segment.target: PolicyName name Optional: Defaults to “UE-V Agent Policy” if not present

segment.source: PolicyDescription description Optional: A description is provided if not present
segment.target: PolicyDescription description Optional: A description is provided if not present

segment.source: CabFilePath full path to configuration item .CAB file
segment.target: CabFilePath full path to configuration item .CAB file

segment.source: ConfigurationFile full path to agent configuration XML file
segment.target: ConfigurationFile full path to agent configuration XML file

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: It might be necessary to change the PowerShell execution policy to allow these scripts to run in your environment.
segment.target: It might be necessary to change the PowerShell execution policy to allow these scripts to run in your environment.

segment.source: Perform these steps in the Configuration Manager console:
segment.target: Perform these steps in the Configuration Manager console:

segment.source: Select Administration Client Settings Properties
segment.target: Select Administration Client Settings Properties

segment.source: In the User Agent tab, set the PowerShell Execution Policy to Bypass
segment.target: In the User Agent tab, set the PowerShell Execution Policy to Bypass

segment.source: Create the First UE-V Policy Configuration Item
segment.target: Create the First UE-V Policy Configuration Item

segment.source: Copy the default settings configuration file from the UE-V Config Pack installation directory to a location visible to your ConfigMgr Admin Console:
segment.target: Copy the default settings configuration file from the UE-V Config Pack installation directory to a location visible to your ConfigMgr Admin Console:

segment.source: The default configuration file contains five sections:
segment.target: The default configuration file contains five sections:

segment.source: Computer Policy
segment.target: Computer Policy

segment.source: All UE-V machine level settings.
segment.target: All UE-V machine level settings.

segment.source: The DesiredState attribute can be
segment.target: The DesiredState attribute can be

segment.source: Set to have the value assigned in the registry
segment.target: Set to have the value assigned in the registry

segment.source: Clear to remove the setting
segment.target: Clear to remove the setting

segment.source: Unmanaged to have the configuration item left at its current state
segment.target: Unmanaged to have the configuration item left at its current state

segment.source: Do not remove lines from this section.
segment.target: Do not remove lines from this section.

segment.source: Instead, set the DesiredState to ‘Unmanaged’ if you do not want Configuration Manager to alter current or default values.
segment.target: Instead, set the DesiredState to ‘Unmanaged’ if you do not want Configuration Manager to alter current or default values.

segment.source: CurrentComputerUserPolicy
segment.target: CurrentComputerUserPolicy

segment.source: All UE-V user level settings.
segment.target: All UE-V user level settings.

segment.source: These entries override the machine settings for a user.
segment.target: These entries override the machine settings for a user.

segment.source: The DesiredState attribute can be
segment.target: The DesiredState attribute can be

segment.source: Set to have the value assigned in the registry
segment.target: Set to have the value assigned in the registry

segment.source: Clear to remove the setting
segment.target: Clear to remove the setting

segment.source: Unmanaged to have the configuration item left at its current state
segment.target: Unmanaged to have the configuration item left at its current state

segment.source: Do not remove lines from this section.
segment.target: Do not remove lines from this section.

segment.source: Instead, set the DesiredState to ‘Unmanaged’ if you do not want Configuration Manager to alter current or default values.
segment.target: Instead, set the DesiredState to ‘Unmanaged’ if you do not want Configuration Manager to alter current or default values.

segment.source: Services
segment.target: Services

segment.source: Entries in this section control service operation.
segment.target: Entries in this section control service operation.

segment.source: The default configuration file contains a single entry for the UevAgentService.
segment.target: The default configuration file contains a single entry for the UevAgentService.

segment.source: The DesiredState attribute can be set to Running or Stopped.
segment.target: The DesiredState attribute can be set to Running or Stopped.

segment.source: Windows8AppsComputerPolicy
segment.target: Windows8AppsComputerPolicy

segment.source: All machine level Windows app synchronization settings.
segment.target: All machine level Windows app synchronization settings.

segment.source: Each PackageFamilyName listed in this section can be assigned a DesiredState of
segment.target: Each PackageFamilyName listed in this section can be assigned a DesiredState of

segment.source: Enabled to have settings roam
segment.target: Enabled to have settings roam

segment.source: Disabled to prevent settings from roaming
segment.target: Disabled to prevent settings from roaming

segment.source: Cleared to have the entry removed from UE-V control
segment.target: Cleared to have the entry removed from UE-V control

segment.source: Additional lines can be added to this section based on the list of installed Windows apps that can be viewed using the PowerShell cmdlet GetAppxPackage.
segment.target: Additional lines can be added to this section based on the list of installed Windows apps that can be viewed using the PowerShell cmdlet GetAppxPackage.

segment.source: Windows8AppsCurrentComputerUserPolicy
segment.target: Windows8AppsCurrentComputerUserPolicy

segment.source: Identical to the Windows8AppsComputerPolicy with settings that override machine settings for an individual user.
segment.target: Identical to the Windows8AppsComputerPolicy with settings that override machine settings for an individual user.

segment.source: Edit the configuration file by changing the desired state and value fields.
segment.target: Edit the configuration file by changing the desired state and value fields.

segment.source: Run this command on a machine running the ConfigMgr Admin Console:
segment.target: Run this command on a machine running the ConfigMgr Admin Console:

segment.source: Import the CAB file using ConfigMgr console or PowerShell Import-CMConfigurationItem
segment.target: Import the CAB file using ConfigMgr console or PowerShell Import-CMConfigurationItem

segment.source: Update a UE-V Policy Configuration Item
segment.target: Update a UE-V Policy Configuration Item

segment.source: Edit the configuration file by changing the desired state and value fields.
segment.target: Edit the configuration file by changing the desired state and value fields.

segment.source: Run the command from Step 3 in Create the First UE-V Policy Configuration Item.
segment.target: Run the command from Step 3 in Create the First UE-V Policy Configuration Item.

segment.source: If you changed the name with the PolicyName parameter, make sure you enter the same name.
segment.target: If you changed the name with the PolicyName parameter, make sure you enter the same name.

segment.source: Reimport the CAB file.
segment.target: Reimport the CAB file.

segment.source: The version in ConfigMgr will be updated.
segment.target: The version in ConfigMgr will be updated.

segment.source: Generate a UE-V Template Baseline
segment.target: Generate a UE-V Template Baseline

segment.source: UE-V templates are distributed using a baseline containing multiple configuration items.
segment.target: UE-V templates are distributed using a baseline containing multiple configuration items.

segment.source: Each configuration item contains the discovery and remediation scripts needed to install one UE-V template.
segment.target: Each configuration item contains the discovery and remediation scripts needed to install one UE-V template.

segment.source: The actual UE-V template is embedded within the remediation script for distribution using standard Configuration Item functionality.
segment.target: The actual UE-V template is embedded within the remediation script for distribution using standard Configuration Item functionality.

segment.source: The UE-V template baseline is created using the UevTemplateBaselineGenerator.exe command line tool, which has these parameters:
segment.target: The UE-V template baseline is created using the UevTemplateBaselineGenerator.exe command line tool, which has these parameters:

segment.source: Site site code
segment.target: Site site code

segment.source: BaselineName name (Optional: defaults to “UE-V Template Distribution Baseline” if not present)
segment.target: BaselineName name (Optional: defaults to “UE-V Template Distribution Baseline” if not present)

segment.source: BaselineDescription description (Optional: a description is provided if not present)
segment.target: BaselineDescription description (Optional: a description is provided if not present)

segment.source: TemplateFolder UE-V template folder
segment.target: TemplateFolder UE-V template folder

segment.source: Register comma separated template file list
segment.target: Register comma separated template file list

segment.source: Unregister comma separated template list
segment.target: Unregister comma separated template list

segment.source: CabFilePath Full path to baseline CAB file to generate
segment.target: CabFilePath Full path to baseline CAB file to generate

segment.source: The result is a baseline CAB file that is ready for import into Configuration Manager.
segment.target: The result is a baseline CAB file that is ready for import into Configuration Manager.

segment.source: If at a future date, you update or add a template, you can rerun the command using the same baseline name.
segment.target: If at a future date, you update or add a template, you can rerun the command using the same baseline name.

segment.source: Importing the CAB results in CI version updates on the changed templates.
segment.target: Importing the CAB results in CI version updates on the changed templates.

segment.source: Create the First UE-V Template Baseline
segment.target: Create the First UE-V Template Baseline

segment.source: Create a “master” set of UE-V templates in a stable folder location visible to the machine running your ConfigMgr Admin Console.
segment.target: Create a “master” set of UE-V templates in a stable folder location visible to the machine running your ConfigMgr Admin Console.

segment.source: As templates are added or updated, this folder is where they are pulled for distribution.
segment.target: As templates are added or updated, this folder is where they are pulled for distribution.

segment.source: The initial list of templates can be copied from a machine with UE-V installed.
segment.target: The initial list of templates can be copied from a machine with UE-V installed.

segment.source: The default template location is C:Program FilesMicrosoft User Experience VirtualizationTemplates.
segment.target: The default template location is C:Program FilesMicrosoft User Experience VirtualizationTemplates.

segment.source: Create a text.bat file where you can add the template generator command.
segment.target: Create a text.bat file where you can add the template generator command.

segment.source: This is optional, but will make regeneration simpler if you save the command parameters.
segment.target: This is optional, but will make regeneration simpler if you save the command parameters.

segment.source: Add the command and parameters to the .bat file that will generate the baseline.
segment.target: Add the command and parameters to the .bat file that will generate the baseline.

segment.source: The following example creates a baseline that distributes Notepad and Calculator:
segment.target: The following example creates a baseline that distributes Notepad and Calculator:

segment.source: Run the .bat file to create UevTemplateBaseline.cab ready for import into Configuration Manager.
segment.target: Run the .bat file to create UevTemplateBaseline.cab ready for import into Configuration Manager.

segment.source: Update a UE-V Template Baseline
segment.target: Update a UE-V Template Baseline

segment.source: The template generator uses the template version to determine if a template should be updated.
segment.target: The template generator uses the template version to determine if a template should be updated.

segment.source: If you make a template change and update the version, the baseline generator compares the template in your master folder with the template contained in the CI on the ConfigMgr server.
segment.target: If you make a template change and update the version, the baseline generator compares the template in your master folder with the template contained in the CI on the ConfigMgr server.

segment.source: If a difference is found, the generated baseline and modified CI versions are updated.
segment.target: If a difference is found, the generated baseline and modified CI versions are updated.

segment.source: To distribute a new Notepad template, you would perform these steps:
segment.target: To distribute a new Notepad template, you would perform these steps:

segment.source: Update the template and template version located in the Version element of the template.
segment.target: Update the template and template version located in the Version element of the template.

segment.source: Copy the template to your master template directory.
segment.target: Copy the template to your master template directory.

segment.source: Run the command in the .bat file that you created in Step 3 in Create the First UE-V Template Baseline.
segment.target: Run the command in the .bat file that you created in Step 3 in Create the First UE-V Template Baseline.

segment.source: Import the generated CAB file into ConfigMgr using the console or PowerShell Import-CMBaseline.
segment.target: Import the generated CAB file into ConfigMgr using the console or PowerShell Import-CMBaseline.

segment.source: Get the UE-V Configuration Pack
segment.target: Get the UE-V Configuration Pack

segment.source: The UE-V Configuration Pack for Configuration Manager 2012 SP1 or later can be downloaded here.
segment.target: The UE-V Configuration Pack for Configuration Manager 2012 SP1 or later can be downloaded here.

segment.target: Got a suggestion for UE-V?

segment.target: Add or vote on suggestions here.

segment.target: For UE-V issues, use the UE-V TechNet Forum.
